snippet: Researchers have found that the wood of a Swedish ship that spent 333 years underwater has weakened by as much as 80 percent, despite preservation efforts.
abstract: Study in journal Biomacromolecules shows that Swedish Viking ship Vasa, discovered in 1956 and preserved in a museum in Stockholm, is deteriorating despite preservation efforts.
lead_paragraph: Researchers have found that the wood of a Swedish ship that spent 333 years underwater has weakened by as much as 80 percent, despite preservation efforts.

headline.print_headline: Even in a Museum, Elements Eat at a Viking Ship
headline.seo: Even in a Museum, Elements Eat at the Warship Vasa
headline.main: Even in a Museum, Elements Eat at a Sunken Ship
